de.unisiegen.tpml.core.bigstep
Class DefaultBigStepProofContext

java.lang.Object
  de.unisiegen.tpml.core.bigstep.DefaultBigStepProofContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
BigStepProofContext
final class DefaultBigStepProofContext
extends Object
implements BigStepProofContext

Default implementation of the BigStepProofContext interface. The big step proof context is used in the big step proof rules (and thereby the rule sets) to communicate with the proof model. For the proof model, the context is used to register redo and undo actions during a single proof step and collect the actions later.

Version:
$Rev: 402 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
AbstractBigStepProofRuleSet, BigStepProofContext

Method Detail

addProofNode

public void addProofNode(BigStepProofNode node,
                         Expression expression)
Adds a new BigStepProofNode for the specified expression as child node for the given node. The method takes care of registering the required redo and undo actions for the BigStepProofModel associated with this proof context. This method acts as a convenience wrapper for the extended #addProofNode(BigStepProofNode, Expression, MutableStore) method, and tries to automatically determine the appropriate store.

Specified by:
addProofNode in interface BigStepProofContext
Parameters:
node - the parent node for the new child node.
expression - the Expression for which to create a new big step proof node below the node.
See Also:
BigStepProofContext.addProofNode(de.unisiegen.tpml.core.bigstep.BigStepProofNode, de.unisiegen.tpml.core.expressions.Expression)

                         Expression expression,
                         Store store)
Adds a new BigStepProofNode for the specified expression and store as child node for the given node. The method takes care of registering the required redo and undo actions for the BigStepProofModel associated with this proof context.

Specified by:
addProofNode in interface BigStepProofContext
Parameters:
node - the parent node for the new child node.
expression - the Expression for which to create a new big step proof node below the node.

isMemoryEnabled

public boolean isMemoryEnabled()
Returns true if the BigStepProofModel associated with this context has memory operations enabled, false otherwise. Several rules - like (APP) - behave differently if memory operations are enabled, so you may need to test this condition.

Specified by:
isMemoryEnabled in interface BigStepProofContext
Returns:
true if memory operations are enabled.
See Also:
BigStepProofContext.isMemoryEnabled()

newNoopRule

public BigStepProofRule newNoopRule(String name)
Allocates a new big step proof rule of the given name that does nothing. This is used to implement various special cases like the (HD-EMPTY) and (TL-EMPTY) rules.

Specified by:
newNoopRule in interface BigStepProofContext
Parameters:
name - the name of the new rule.
Returns:
the newly allocated BigStepProofRule.
See Also:
BigStepProofContext.newNoopRule(java.lang.String)

Changes the result of the specified node to the given result. The method takes care of registering the required redo and undo actions for the BigStepProofModel associated with this proof context.

setProofNodeResult in interface BigStepProofContext
Parameters:
node - the node, whose result to change to the result.
result - the new result for the specified node.

setProofNodeResult

public void setProofNodeResult(BigStepProofNode node,
                               Expression value)
This method is a convenience wrapper for the #setProofNodeResult(BigStepProofNode, Expression, MutableStore) method, which simply passes the Store from the specified node (determined using the InterpreterProofNode.getStore() method) as store for the BigStepProofResult, together with the value.

Specified by:
setProofNodeResult in interface BigStepProofContext
Parameters:
node - the node, whose result to change to value.
value - the new value for the specified node.
See Also:
BigStepProofContext.setProofNodeResult(de.unisiegen.tpml.core.bigstep.BigStepProofNode, de.unisiegen.tpml.core.expressions.Expression)

setProofNodeResult

public void setProofNodeResult(BigStepProofNode node,
                               Expression value,
                               Store store)
Changes the result of the specified node to a new big step result with the given value and store. This is a convenience wrapper for BigStepProofContext.setProofNodeResult(BigStepProofNode, BigStepProofResult). The method takes care of registering the required redo and undo actions for the BigStepProofModel associated with this proof context.

Specified by:
setProofNodeResult in interface BigStepProofContext
Parameters:
node - the node, whose result to change to value and store.
value - the new value for the specified node.
store - the resulting store.
See Also:
BigStepProofContext.setProofNodeResult(de.unisiegen.tpml.core.bigstep.BigStepProofNode, de.unisiegen.tpml.core.expressions.Expression, de.unisiegen.tpml.core.interpreters.Store)

setProofNodeRule

public void setProofNodeRule(BigStepProofNode node,
                             BigStepProofRule rule)
Changes the big step proof rule of the specified node to the given rule. This affects the proof steps of the node (see the common.ProofNode#getSteps() method for details. The method takes care of registering the required redo and undo actions for the BigStepProofModel associated with this proof context.

Specified by:
setProofNodeRule in interface BigStepProofContext
Parameters:
node - the node, whose associated proof step to change to a step for the specified rule.
rule - the new rule to use for the proof step for node.
See Also:
BigStepProofContext.setProofNodeRule(de.unisiegen.tpml.core.bigstep.BigStepProofNode, de.unisiegen.tpml.core.bigstep.BigStepProofRule)

apply

void apply(BigStepProofRule rule,
           BigStepProofNode node)
     throws ProofRuleException
Used to implement the BigStepProofModel.apply(BigStepProofRule, DefaultBigStepProofNode) method in the BigStepProofModel class. Applies the rule to the node, recording rule for the node and recording all further actions that were performed, including the actions required to undo the application step.

Parameters:
rule - the big step proof rule.
node - the big step proof node.
Throws:
ProofRuleException - if the application of rule to node fails.

revert

void revert()
Used to implement the BigStepProofModel.apply(BigStepProofRule, DefaultBigStepProofNode) method in the BigStepProofModel class. Reverts all previously performed actions, using the recorded undo actions. The recorded undo actions will be cleared afterwards.

updateNode

void updateNode(BigStepProofNode node)
Updates the node after a change to one of its child nodes. This is needed for non-axiom rules, like (APP), that need to react to proof steps on child nodes. If the node is already proven, no action will be performed. If all child nodes are finished and one of the child nodes resulted in an exception, the first such exception will be forwarded to the node. Otherwise the BigStepProofRule.update(BigStepProofContext, BigStepProofNode) method of the rule that was applied to node will be executed to update the state of the node.

Parameters:
node - the node to update.
See Also:
apply(BigStepProofRule, BigStepProofNode)
